metadata.title: CVE-2018-11759 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The Apache Web Server (httpd) specific code that normalised the requestedpath before matching it to the URI-worker map in Apache Tomcat JK (mod_jk)Connector 1.2.0 to 1.2.44 did not handle some edge cases correctly. If onlya sub-set of the URLs supported by Tomcat were exposed via httpd, then itwas possible for a specially constructed request to expose applicationfunctionality through the reverse proxy that was not intended for clientsaccessing the application via the reverse proxy. It was also possible insome configurations for a specially constructed request to bypass theaccess controls configured in httpd. While there is some overlap betweenthis issue and CVE-2018-1323, they are not identical.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11759` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-jk - 1:1.2.46-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libapache-mod-jk package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.2.46-1').
